title: CH Eying Kiwi and Fiji
byline: Last season’s Plate champs CH and FC have set their sights on signing a foreign player ahead of the inter club league rugby tournament next week.

title: Fire breaks out at matchbox factory in Pallekele
byline: A fire broke out at a matchbox factory in Pallekele, Kandy, last night (5), causing panic in the area.

title: Anisimova joins undefeated Rybakina in Riyadh semis
byline: Amanda Anisimova ’’embraced the fight’’ to overcome Iga Swiatek in three sets and join the undefeated Elena Rybakina in the knockout stage of the WTA Finals.

title: NBA officials brief Congress committee over gambling probe
byline: NBA officials met with a United States congressional committee on Wednesday regarding a gambling and sports betting investigation that included arrests for Miami’s Terry Rozier and ex-Portland coach Chauncey Billups, according to multiple reports.

title: RCB for sale, Diageo confirms process underway
byline: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) has officially been put up for sale by owner Diageo, which has begun the process and aims to complete it by March 31, 2026. The move could mark a new era for one of the IPL’s most popular and valuable franchises.

title: Wellalage to Lead Sri Lanka A in ACC Rising Stars Asia Cup
byline: Left-arm spinner Dunith Wellalage has been named captain of Sri Lanka A for the upcoming ACC Rising Stars Asia Cup T20 2025, scheduled to be held in Doha later this month.

title: Four arrested with heroin and ICE in Homagama
byline: Four individuals, including a woman, have been arrested after police discovered a large stock of heroin and ICE during a raid in Homagama.

title: Sri Lanka risks losing USD 70 million debt relief– Verité Research
byline: Sri Lanka may lose out on USD 70 million in potential debt relief under its Governance-Linked Bond (GLB) due to a fiscal planning oversight, according to Verité Research.

title: New Rs. 30,000 subsidy for coconut growers in Northern Coconut Triangle
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board announced that the government will provide a subsidy of Rs. 30,000 per acre to coconut growers in the newly established Northern Coconut Triangle.

title: Millions spent, lives still lost on the road
byline: An audit report on the National Council for Road Safety (NCRS) has revealed that although 1,169 hit-and-run accidents were reported in Sri Lanka over the past five years, only 247 compensation applications were submitted during that period.

title: Trillions spent on goods Sri Lanka can easily produce locally
byline: Sri Lanka continues to spend trillions of rupees importing products that could easily be cultivated or produced locally, a costly trend that has persisted for over a decade despite the country’s rich agricultural potential.

title: Sri Lankan Opposition leader backs India’s bid for permanent UNSC seat
byline: Sri Lanka’s Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has backed India’s long-pending bid for a permanent seat at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC), calling it a recognition of “global power realities” and that he will continue to support that effort.

title: US orders 10% flights cut at major US airports due to shutdown
byline: U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said on Wednesday that he would order a 10% cut in flights at 40 major U.S. airports, citing air traffic control safety concerns as a government shutdown hit a record 36th day.

title: Trump administration has revoked 80,000 non-immigrant visas, US official says
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration has revoked around 80,000 non-immigrant visas since its inauguration on January 20 for offenses ranging from driving under the influence to assault and theft, a senior State Department official said on Wednesday.

title: RCB for sale, Diageo confirms process underway
byline: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) has officially been put up for sale by owner Diageo, which has begun the process and aims to complete it by March 31, 2026. The move could mark a new era for one of the IPL’s most popular and valuable franchises.

title: Racket to sell ancient reservoirs and paddy lands in Anuradhapura: Farmers’ Union
byline: A large-scale racket is currently underway to reclaim and sell ancient reservoirs and paddy lands surrounding the sacred city of Anuradhapura, Chairman of the National Farmers’ Union, Anuradha Tennakoon, told the Daily Mirror.

title: Third school term ends tomorrow
byline: The Education Ministry announced that the first phase of the third school term for all government and government-approved private schools for the year 2025 will conclude tomorrow (November 7).

title: High Court sets November 12 for Yoshitha Rajapaksa case
byline: The Colombo High Court today fixed November 12 for the pre-trial conference in the case filed by the Attorney General against Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and Daisy Forrest.

title: Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan join forces for new film after 40 years
byline: Indian superstars Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan are reuniting for a new film after more than 40 years, sending waves of excitement through the Tamil cinema world.

title: American woman found dead in house
byline: An American woman on a visit to Sri Lanka was found dead in a house at Dharmasoka Mawatha in Aruppola off Kandy.

title: Prisons should be schools of transformation: Justice Minister
byline: Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said that prisons should no longer be seen as places of punishment, but as schools of transformation that offer inmates a second chance at life.

title: Philippines declares state of calamity as typhoon death toll rises to 114
byline: Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr has declared a state of calamity after Typhoon Kalmaegi, one of the strongest typhoons this year, caused severe flooding in central Philippines, leaving at least 114 dead.

title: Media Law Forum relaunches 24/7 legal hotline for environmental journalists
byline: The Media Law Forum (MLF) has relaunched its 24/7 Emergency Legal Hotline dedicated to providing immediate legal assistance to environmental journalists in Sri Lanka.

title: President reviews final draft of 2026 budget proposals
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake reviewed the final draft of the 2026 Budget proposals last night (05) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Aswesuma beneficiaries should feel ashamed: Handunnetti
byline: Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Handunnetti yesterday said that those accepting Aswesuma benefits should be ashamed, describing it as “legal begging.”

title: Fake CID officer who robbed 25 men nabbed in Athurugiriya
byline: A former police officer who had posed as a senior CID officer and allegedly robbed more than 25 young men of their cash and valuables, along with two accomplices, was arrested yesterday by the Athurugiriya Police.

title: Rajarata University crippled by strike action
byline: The strike of work by the University Teachers’ Association of Rajarata University reached the seventh day yesterday much to the anxiety of the students.

title: Prices of 40 varieties of goods reduced by 19% last month: Minister
byline: Prices of 40 varieties of goods that are most frequently purchased by consumers has reduced by 19 percent in October this year when compared to October last year, Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe said yesterday.

title: America’s WTI crude unqualified to enter Sri Lanka due to lack of price competitiveness
byline: Despite Sri Lanka’s decision to import crude oil from the United States, its WTI (West Texas Intermediate) crude has not qualified to enter the Sri Lankan market because it is not price -competitive this time, an official said.

title: ‘Ratama Ekata’ nets 980 drug suspects
byline: Police conducted 1,053 anti-drug raids across the country under the ongoing ‘Ratama Ekata’ national operation, arresting 980 suspects yesterday.

title: Torrential rain causes flooding in Ratnapura
byline: Low-lying areas in Ratnapura, Kuruvita, Elapatha, and Kiriella have been inundated this afternoon following more than 12 hours of torrential rain.

title: Qatar Airways sells entire Cathay Pacific stake for US$897 million
byline: State-owned Qatar Airways has decided to sell its entire stake in Cathay Pacific Airways for about US$897 million (HK$6.97 billion), marking its complete exit from Hong Kong’s flagship airline.

title: Govt. boosts support for science and technology to build sustainable future
byline: Science and technology are vital forces shaping Sri Lanka’s sustainable future, noting that the government is taking significant steps to enhance support for these sectors, Science and Technology, Professor Chrishantha Abeysena Minister said.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo plans to retire from football for family reasons
byline: Cristiano Ronaldo says he will retire “soon”, admitting it will be difficult to bring his glittering career to an end as the 40-year-old has been planning his post-football life for some time.

title: Sri Lanka continues fight against leprosy, targets elimination by 2035
byline: Although Sri Lanka successfully eliminated leprosy as a public health threat in 1995, new cases continue to emerge, Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: ’’What’s your skincare routine,’’ Harleen Deol asks PM Modi. His reply
byline: As Prime Minister Modi met and commended the Indian women’s cricket team for their ’’remarkable resilience and comeback’’ in the World Cup, he was asked a cheeky question: What is his skincare routine?

title: Opposition calls for public views on budget
byline: The opposition has decided to call for public opinion on the budget in order to ensure an effective debate.

title: Pre trial conference on Keheliya Rambukwella vaccine case to begin on November 26
byline: The Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar today ordered that the pre trial conference in the case filed by the Attorney General against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and 11 others over the alleged purchase of substandard immunoglobulin vaccines using government funds, be commenced on November 26.

title: We are not here to topple the govt — We are here to awaken them” - SLPP
byline: On the 21st of this month, we will take to the streets. Not to cause chaos. Not to overthrow the NPP government. But we are rallying because this government has stopped listening — and someone needs to remind them that power comes with responsibility.

title: Election for new Diyawadana Nilame at Sri Dalada Maligawa tomorrow
byline: All arrangements have been finalized for the selection of a new Diyawadana Nilame for the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy, which is scheduled to take place tomorrow (07).

title: Writ petitions by national cricketers: Court proposes administrative resolution
byline: The Court of Appeal today proposed that the writ petitions filed by Sri Lanka National Cricket players challenging the classification of Sri Lanka’s national cricketers as employees of the national association Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), by the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) should be resolved with a meeting of the stake holders in the interest of the game of cricket.

title: Vijitha Herath to attend UNWTO General Assembly in Riyadh
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, will undertake an official visit to Riyadh, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, from November 8 to 11, 2025, to attend the 26th Session of the General Assembly of the World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on appeals by seven in Vidya murder case
byline: The Supreme Court today reserved its judgment in appeals filed by seven accused who were sentenced to death for the murder and gang rape of Sivaloganathan Vidya.

title: Tree falls on bus in Kandy, one killed, 10 injured
byline: A man was killed and ten others injured when a pine tree fell over a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus plying from Kandy to Hewaheta at Halwatte this afternoon.

title: NPP Peliyagoda UC member resigns after husband’s arrest over drugs
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) Peliyagoda Urban Council member, whose husband and son were arrested for drug smuggling, has resigned.

title: GMOA confident Govt will resolve issues within health service
byline: The Secretary of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), Dr. Prabath Sugathadasa, expressed confidence that the 2026 Budget is a positive step toward addressing the issues in the health sector and that the government will take the necessary measures to resolve them.

title: After eight years behind bars, Court frees man sentenced to death
byline: A man who had spent eight years in prison under a death sentence for drug trafficking was acquitted by the Court of Appeal, which found that the raid and recovery of productions in the case had not met the test of probability.

title: Locally manufactured school shoes to replace vouchers in pilot programme: Minister
byline: The government will implement a pilot project to provide quality, locally manufactured school shoes to replace the vouchers currently given to schools with fewer than 250 students, Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Handunnetti said.
